info.headline: Excessive Heat Watch issued July 24 at 3:58PM MDT until July 30 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Afternoon temperatures will reach the upper 90s to near 100 degrees. Overnight temperatures will have a harder time cooling off the longer the heatwave lasts. * WHERE...Wallace, Osburn, Cataldo, Kellogg, St. Maries, Medimont, Santa, St. Joe, Fernwood, Lookout Pass, Emida, Mullan, and Pinehurst. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. Residents without air conditioners will experience a build up of heat within their home through late in the week.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors.
